docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 21--As a troop of mounted polocemen charged down Montevideo's main downtown street last night, crowds of pedestrians scattered on the run, but one young man paused to yell an insult.

docs.abstract: Fears that tourist trade will decline because of civil disorders noted

headline.main: Embattled Montevideo Hopes Tourist Season Will End Riots

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 22 -- The Government closed down universities and secondary schools here and called out the army today after days of bloody street fighting.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 22 -- The Government closed down universities and secondary schools here and called out the army today after days of bloody street fighting.
docs.abstract: Govt closes schools, calls out troops; protesters stage demonstration for funeral of 2 slain students, disrupt bus traffic, Montevideo; disorders seen embarrassing to Pacheco, meeting with Argentine Pres Ongania in Salto

headline.main: URUGUAY SHUTS SCHOOLS IN CRISIS; Troops Called in Montevideo to Help Keep Order

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 23 (AP) -- The war of nerves developing over the soccer club match final between Manchester United of England and Estudiantes of Argentina became more tense today judging from the reaction of British newspapers.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Sept. 24 -- The Government of Uruguay, which has been trying for the last three months to suppress a nearly continuous wave of strikes and street violence, today ordered the expulsion of three officials of the Soviet Embassy here.

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 4 (AP) -- A surging mob of 2,000 students hurled stones and broke windows at the United States Consulate today before police stopped the demonstration with tear gas and night-sticks.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 4 (AP) -- A surging mob of 2,000 students hurled stones and broke windows at the United States Consulate today before police stopped the demonstration with tear gas and night-sticks.
docs.abstract: student mob stones US Consulate, other bldgs, Santiago, Chile; proclaims solidarity with Peruvian people

headline.main: THOUSANDS IN CHILE STONE U.S. BUILDING

headline.main: Peru; Again the Military for a Latin Country

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 7 -- The deposed Peruvian President, Fernando Belaunde Terry, marked his 56th birthday today and said in an interview that a decree setting elections in Peru on June 8, 1969, was still valid.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 7 -- The deposed Peruvian President, Fernando Belaunde Terry, marked his 56th birthday today and said in an interview that a decree setting elections in Peru on June 8, 1969, was still valid.
docs.abstract: Belaunde declares June 8 election should proceed as scheduled, int, Buenos Aires; scores junta pretext of oil dispute; is warned by Argentina to refrain from pub declarations; says he will leave country
